part2.question:
Describe a person who encouraged you to protect nature. You should say:
Who this person is
How you knew this person
What he/she said or did to encourage you
And explain how you felt about it.
part2.model_answer: I would like to commence by describing my high school biology teacher, Mr. Chen, who was an incredibly Conscientious [尽责的] and Passionate [热情的] man. He was a true Advocate [提倡者] for the environment who inspired us daily. Even though he was extremely busy with grading papers, he would spend his weekends organizing community clean-ups because he believed we must Practice what you preach [言行一致]. He taught us how to be Eco-friendly [环保的] in our daily lives by reducing plastic usage. His dedication was truly Inspiring [鼓舞人心的] to everyone in my class. As a result, I became a Nature lover [热爱大自然的人] myself. I learned that living a Sustainable [可持续的] lifestyle is a necessary responsibility for our future.

part2.question:
Describe a person who is very interested in the environment. You should say:
Who they are
What they do to help the environment
How they influence others
And explain what you have learned from them.
part2.model_answer: I have chosen to talk about my neighbor, Sarah, who is a committed Nature lover [热爱大自然的人] in our community. Since she wants to live a completely Sustainable [可持续的] life, she grows her own organic vegetables and avoids all single-use plastics to reduce waste. She is very Conscientious [尽责的] about her carbon footprint. In fact, she always tries to Do one's bit [尽自己的一份力] by recycling food waste in her garden. Her behavior is quite Predictable [可预测的] because she never changes from her principles. She is a tireless Advocate [提倡者] for green living. She is Passionate [热情的] about being Eco-friendly [环保的] and keeping the air clean.

part2.question:
Describe an environmental activist or leader you admire. You should say:
Who this person is
What cause they fight for
How they spread their message
And explain why you respect their efforts.
part2.model_answer: I deeply admire Greta Thunberg, who is a young but fierce Advocate [提倡者] for climate action globally. She is Passionate [热情的] about saving the planet and is not afraid to speak truth to power. Although some people find her methods intense, she always manages to Practice what you preach [言行一致] by traveling via Eco-friendly [环保的] transport methods like trains. Her speeches are Inspiring [鼓舞人心的] and have educated a generation to the crisis. She reminds us daily that we must Do one's bit [尽自己的一份力] before it is too late. She is Conscientious [尽责的] about her Sustainable [可持续的] choices. I am a Nature lover [热爱大自然的人] because of her work.

part3.question: How do people protect the environment?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Typically, individuals protect nature by reducing waste and conserving energy in their homes everyday. Reason Small, consistent actions in daily life accumulate to make a massive positive difference over time. Example Unless we stop using plastic bags, Pollution [污染] will continue to damage the Biodiversity [生物多样性] of our oceans forever without any hope.

part3.question: Do you think it's important to protect wild animals/nature?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Yes, it is absolutely vital to protect global Biodiversity [生物多样性] for our own long-term survival. Reason Every animal plays a specific and crucial role in the ecosystem, and losing them causes collapse. Example Since human activity can Wreak havoc [造成严重破坏] on delicate food chains, we must prioritize Conservation [保护] efforts immediately to save them.

part3.question: What are the main environmental problems in your country?
part3.model_answer: Opinion The most pressing issue is severe air Pollution [污染] caused by countless factories and heavy traffic. Reason Rapid industrialization has led to poor air quality in many major cities. Example Although the government is trying to fix it, the visible smog is just the Tip of the iceberg [冰山一角] regarding health.

part3.question: Do you think we should use more renewable energy? Why?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Unquestionably, we must switch to Renewable [可再生的] energy sources like solar and wind power immediately. Reason Fossil fuels are running out quickly and are the primary cause of global warming today. Example Whereas oil causes Pollution [污染], solar power is clean, infinite, and completely Sustainable [可持续的] for the future planet we inhabit.

part3.question: Should schools teach students about environmental protection?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Yes, schools play a key role in preventing the mass Extinction [灭绝] of endangered species globally. Reason Children are the future leaders, and they need to understand their impact early on in life. Example Provided that students learn about Conservation [保护] in primary school, they will grow up to be responsible citizens.

part3.question: [New] How effective is international cooperation in solving global environmental crises?
part3.model_answer: Opinion It is essential, though sometimes individual country efforts feel like A drop in the ocean [沧海一粟]. Reason Environmental issues like climate change do not respect national borders or boundaries in any way. Example Whenever countries work together, they can have an Influential [有影响力的] effect on reducing global carbon emissions together.
